meanings.sent1: She cuckooed her friend into believing a tall tale.
meanings.sent2: The magician cuckooed the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous boy cuckooed his sister by hiding her favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The con artist cuckooed innocent people out of their savings.
meanings.sent5: The fox cuckooed the rabbit into thinking it was safe to come out of its burrow.

meanings.definition: To make a sound like a cuckoo bird
meanings.sent1: The cuckoo cuckooed from the treetop in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The toy cuckoo clock cuckooed every hour.
meanings.sent3: The child's toy cuckooed unexpectedly during the night, scaring the cat.
meanings.sent4: The cuckoo cuckooed a melodious tune that echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The cuckoo bird cuckooed a cheerful song to welcome the sunrise.

meanings.definition: To be cheated or swindled by someone
meanings.sent1: He felt cuckooed when he realized he had bought a fake watch.
meanings.sent2: The tourists were cuckooed by the street vendor into purchasing overpriced souvenirs.
meanings.sent3: The old man chuckled when he realized he had been cuckooed by the young scam artist.
meanings.sent4: She never expected to be cuckooed by her own family member.
meanings.sent5: The unsuspecting couple was cuckooed by the smooth-talking salesman into buying a faulty car.
